sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using matrix methods
message_1:
Consider the system of linear equations: 

3x + 2y = 11 

4x - 3y = 3 

Use matrix methods to find the values of x and y.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using matrix methods, we will first write the given system in the matrix form AX = B, where A is the matrix of coefficients, X is the column matrix of variables, and B is the column matrix of constants.

Given system:
3x + 2y = 11
4x - 3y = 3

Matrix form:
A = | 3  2 |, X = | x |, B = | 11 |
    | 4 -3 |      | y |      |  3 |

Now, we will find the inverse of matrix A (A_inv) and then multiply it with matrix B to get the values of x and y.

Step 1: Find the determinant of matrix A.
det(A) = (3 * -3) - (2 * 4) = -9 - 8 = -17

Step 2: Find the adjoint of matrix A.
Adjoint(A) = | -3 -2 |
                     | -4  3 |

Step 3: Find the inverse of matrix A (A_inv).
A_inv = (1/det(A)) * Adjoint(A)
A_inv = (1/-17) * | -3 -2 |
                          | -4  3 |

A_inv = | 3/17  2/17 |
            | 4/17 -3/17 |

Step 4: Multiply A_inv with B to get the values of x and y.
X = A_inv * B

X = | 3/17  2/17 | * | 11 |
       | 4/17 -3/17 |   |  3 |

x = (3/17 * 11) + (2/17 * 3) = 33/17 + 6/17 = 39/17
y = (4/17 * 11) - (3/17 * 3) = 44/17 - 9/17 = 35/17

So, the values of x and y are:
x = 39/17
y = 35/17
